definition: variant pronunciation (when the same character has more than one reading)
different/other/hetero-/unusual/strange/surprising/to distinguish/to separate/to discriminate
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
comma/phrase marked by pause
word having alternative pronunciations

sentences.english: The command of the accurate pronunciation of polyphonic characters is the key to the standardization of Chinese character pronunciation.
sentences.chinese: 准确掌握多音异读字是人们规范认读汉字的关键。

sentences.english: Chapter II briefly describes analysis of Quanzhou County, Caiwan dialect's Wen and Bai reading.
sentences.chinese: 第二章简要描写分析了全州县才湾话的文白异读。

sentences.english: Chapter Three Literal and Colloquial Pronunciations and Phonetic Layers in Yanchuan Dialect.
sentences.chinese: 第三章“延川方言的文白异读与语音层次”。

sentences.english: In those passages where there is a variant reading, no doctrine of Scripture is affected.
sentences.chinese: 这些有着‘异读’的段落并不影响圣经的教义。

sentences.english: Different reading is an important voice phenomenon of ancient Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 异读是古汉语的一个重要语音现象。

sentences.english: There are some passages in the New Testament in which we have 'variant readings.
sentences.chinese: 我们对于一些新约的圣经段落有着‘异读’。

definition: pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
(Chinese linguistics) zero initial (the initial of a syllable that does not begin with a consonant)
reading/pronunciation (of a Chinese character)
loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
reading or phonetic value of a character
entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
sound and meaning
homophonic characters
variant character/loan word/variant written form (for the same word)/different edition
variant Chinese character
character with two or more readings
nonstandard form of a Chinese character
character having several readings and meanings
phonetic change
phonetic value of a character
